text: Meopta Mikroma is an all metal 16mm subminiature camera made by Meopta in Czechoslovakia, after World War II.William White Ph.D Subminiature Photography Focal Press 1990 p101-103 Meopta Mikroma 16mm subminiature camera Meopta Mikroma II 16mm subminiature camera ==Features== *Dimension: 74mm x 35mm x 28mm *Weight: 225g *Lens: Meopta Mirar 20mm /3.5 triplet (Cooke style) *Focusing dial (Meter) 0.5，0.7，1，1.2；1.3，1.5，1.7，2，2.5，3.5，50，10，infinity *Aperture 3.5-16 *Counter: 1 to 50 *Mechanical shutter *Mikroma B,25,50,100,200 *Mikroma II B,5,10,25,50,100,200,400 *Film: 16mm single perforated film *Frame size 11.5 x14 ==Accessories== *Copy stand *Close up attachment lens 0.33-0.5m, 0.5-1m *Filter set: UV,YELLOW, RED, GREEN, LIGHT GREEN *Supply side cassette and take up side cassette *16mm Meopta development tank *Genuine leather case ==Pictures== File:Mikroma II top plate.jpg|Mikroma II top view File:SnakeMikroma.jpg|Snake skin Mikroma II File:Mikroma II dark brown snake skin.jpg|Light brown snake skin Mikroam II File:Snake skin Mikroma II with box.jpg|Dark brown snake skin Mikroma II deluxe wooden box File:Meopta Mikroma cassette.jpg|Mikroma cassette File:Mikroma filter and close up lenses.jpg|Mikroma close up lens and filters File:Mikroma camera case.jpg|Leather case File:Meopta 16mm development tank.jpg|Meopta 16mm development tank ==References== ==External links== *Mikroma II * Mikroma II *flickr Category:Subminiature cameras
title: Meopta Mikroma
